poem:
**A Morning's Headline**

The ink dries in columns,
a choir of doubts rustling
like leaves in an undecided autumn.

Biden's name hovers, tethered
to strings of uncertain air,
his promises caught mid-flight.

A virtual roll call echoes,
fear dances behind closed doors.
The future, like a paper boat,
drifts, its course neither clear nor still.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "More Democrats call for Biden to exit 2024 race as president vows to return to campaign trail – live 9.02pm BST Earlier on Friday, Kamarck, a member of the DNC’s rules committee, told delegates and reporters that the move to hold a virtual roll call was not an effort to “rubber stamp” Biden’s nomination but “born out of just paranoia about the Republican in Ohio.” If the party were to formally nominate Biden and then". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
